Results from in vivo expression studies performed with these NF-kappa B p65 mutants revealed the following : 1 ) I kappa B / MAD-3 completely inhibits NF-kappa B p65 - dependent transcriptional activation mediated through the human immunodeficiency virus type 1 kappa B enhancer in human T lymphocytes , 2 ) the binding of I kappa B / MAD-3 to NF-kappa B p65 is sufficient to <extra_id_0> retarget <extra_id_2> Localization <extra_id_1> NF-kappa B p65 from the nucleus to the cytoplasm , 3 ) selective deletion of the functional nuclear localization signal present in the Rel homology domain of NF-kappa B p65 disrupts its ability to engage I kappa B / MAD-3 , and 4 ) the unique C-terminus of NF-kappa B p65 attenuates its own nuclear localization and contains sequences that are required for I kappa B - mediated inhibition of NF-kappa B p65 DNA binding activity .

Results from in vivo expression studies performed with these NF-kappa B p65 mutants revealed the following : 1 ) I kappa B / MAD-3 completely inhibits NF-kappa B p65 - dependent transcriptional activation mediated through the human immunodeficiency virus type 1 kappa B enhancer in human T lymphocytes , 2 ) the binding of I kappa B / MAD-3 to NF-kappa B p65 is sufficient to retarget NF-kappa B <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_2> Theme <extra_id_1> from the nucleus to the cytoplasm , 3 ) selective deletion of the functional nuclear localization signal present in the Rel homology domain of NF-kappa B p65 disrupts its ability to engage I kappa B / MAD-3 , and 4 ) the unique C-terminus of NF-kappa B p65 attenuates its own nuclear localization and contains sequences that are required for I kappa B - mediated inhibition of NF-kappa B p65 DNA binding activity .
